comment.authorname: Úbeda y un cordero en Flandes

comment.author: 31837087@N07
comment._content:
I blame a cruel corset for the less than comfortable look on her face; what an inhumane practice that was.
The hip to waist ratio is aberrant.

comment.author: 36684109@N05
comment._content: Corsets actually aren't that uncomfortable if worn correctly, . . .

comment.author: 45705704@N00
comment._content: Rayezor, as an opera singer she could ill afford to bow to fashion to the extreme some women did (even the possibility of endangering your lungs is horrifying to an opera singer; it's your whole livelihood!), and she almost certainly could have afforded the money to have her clothing custom made (which makes corsets very comfortable). Please stop spreading myths you don't understand.

comment.author: 12306929@N04
comment._content: I no longer wonder what the origin of the expression "Up-Tight" is !

comment.author: 36396592@N05
comment._content: lovely picture and her dress reminds me of the one Emilio made this week on Project Runway -- the way the striped fabric is draped across the front.

comment._content: I don't think a true soprano would have to make her "boobs look larger"--they usually ARE! And what's with this odd outfit? Interesting but I can't place it.
